body.p: Our development of new and exciting stuff is done in the experimental Java subversion repository. You can find it at https://svn.gentooexperimental.org/svn/java/. If you would like to make a checkout of one of these projects, you will, of course, have to emerge subversion.
The Java team has several overlays, each with their own purpose
The purpose of this experimental overlay is to serve as a sandbox for exciting new packages which aren't quite ready for prime-time. Some highlights of this overlay include:
body.pre: # mkdir -p /usr/local/overlays/java-experimental # svn co https://svn.gentooexperimental.org/svn/java/gentoo-java-experimental /usr/local/overlays/java-experimental Edit /etc/make.conf and add /usr/local/overlays/java-experimental to PORTDIR_OVERLAY, i.e. PORTDIR_OVERLAY="${PORTDIR_OVERLAY} /usr/local/overlays/java-experimental"
body.p: Now you should be all set to emerge packages from the experimental tree.
You should also update the overlay from time to time.

The purpose of this overlay is ultimately unmask Java 1.5. Essentially, we have a new system for building Java packages that would allow this. The overlay contains the glue that will allow us to migrate from the existing system to the new one. Please refer to the Java 1.5 FAQ for full details.

One of our users, Chewi, made huge changes to the eclipse eclass. We are now able to build most of the Eclipse plugins which are only in portage as binary packages from source, instead of relying on binary packages. chewi-overlay. He also has a README explaining the changes.
body.note: Some of the plugins in this overlay require packages only found in the experimental overlay!
body.pre: # mkdir -p /usr/local/overlays/chewi-overlay # svn co https://svn.gentooexperimental.org/svn/java/chewi-overlay /usr/local/overlays/chewi-overlay Edit /etc/make.conf and add /usr/local/overlays/chewi-overlay to PORTDIR_OVERLAY, i.e. PORTDIR_OVERLAY="${PORTDIR_OVERLAY} /usr/local/overlays/chewi-overlay"
body.p: You should also update the overlay occaisionally.
